votebox.middle.writein

Class WriteInCandidateGUI

  • java.lang.Object
    • java.awt.Component
      • java.awt.Container
        • java.awt.Window
          • java.awt.Dialog
            • javax.swing.JDialog
              • votebox.middle.writein.WriteInCandidateGUI
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.awt.image.ImageObserver, java.awt.MenuContainer, java.io.Serializable, javax.accessibility.Accessible, javax.swing.RootPaneContainer, javax.swing.WindowConstants

    public class WriteInCandidateGUI
extends javax.swing.JDialog
    A graphical user interface that allows the voter to type in a candidate's name. Based on the name that the voter enters, it renders an image that display the candidate's name and adds it to the ballot files.
    See Also:
    Serialized Form

    • Constructor Detail

      • WriteInCandidateGUI

        public WriteInCandidateGUI(int cX,
                   int cY,
                   java.lang.String uid,
                   java.lang.String guiType,
                   java.lang.Boolean useKeyListeners,
                   Card parent)
        Create the GUI and build its GUI Elements.
        Parameters:
        cX - the x-coordinate of the center of the GUI
        cY - the y-coordinate of the center of the GUI
        uid - the UID of the candidate
        guiType - the Type of GUI to start (Regular or Presidential)
        useKeyListeners - whether or not to use KeyListeners
